Manual installation

Source: vignettes/manual-installation.Rmd
manual-installation.Rmd

Apart from precommit::use_precommit(), you can install pre-commit manually as described in the official documentation. Then, set the R option precommit.executable to the path where the pre-commit executable lives.

If you’ve installed pre-commit, you can add it to a specific project by adding a .pre-commit-config.yaml file that has a structure like this:

repos:
-   repo: https://github.com/lorenzwalthert/precommit
    rev: v0.0.0.9016
    hooks: 
    -   id: style-files
    -   id: parsable-R
    -   id: no-browser-statement
    -   id: readme-rmd-rendered
    -   id: roxygenize
    -   id: use-tidy-description
    -   id: deps-in-desc
    -   id: lintr

The repo key points to the place where the source code of the hooks are stored, not the repo you want to apply them to.

Some hooks also take arguments, see vignette("hook-arguments").

If you want to see the file .pre-commit-config.yaml in RStudio, you have to enable “Show Hidden Files” in the Files Pane of RStudio under More.

Next, run pre-commit install in your repo and you are done.

Developed by Lorenz Walthert.
